page.title: 08THE PONTESBURY OPTICIAN
page.content:
The Optician holds a surgery in Pontesbury and has a shop and workshop in Shrewsbury. He treats around 70 to 80 patients a week. 80% of his patients are adults and 20% children.
He works 55 hours a week and he does house to house calls as well. The biggest eye problem he deals with is long sightedness. In his opinion the biggest eye disease of the eighties is tunnel vision.
The Optician makes all his own glasses on the premises in his workshop. The way in which he tests eyes now is with a computer which gives a readout. The average age of his patients is 45 years old. He says that carrots can help to improve eyesight as they contain Vitamin A!
